member.summary: Axis inherits from RangeAxis and adds functionality for scroll, scale, auto range of the axis. Also it contains gridlines, stripes, thumb.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.Calculate
member.summary: Calculates the interval, min and max for the current axis based on data points, axis type and Timeline type. If we're allowing only one of each types of axis, then the min and max has to be based on all series.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, is invoked whenever application code or internal processes (such as a rebuilding layout pass) call .

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.OnPropertyChanged(System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Method invoked when a property is changed on this axis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.AutoRange
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Minimum, Maximum and Unit are automatically calculated. To create manual range AutoRange property has to be set to false and Minimum, Maximum and Unit have to be set.
member.remarks: By default, chart determines the minimum and maximum range values of the axis. You can customize the scale to better meet your needs. The default value for AutoRange is true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.ScrollScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale of the scrollable area, expressed as a value between 0 and 1.
member.value: The scale of the scrollable area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.ScrollPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the current view inside the scrollable area, expressed as a value between 0 and 1.
member.value: The position of the current view inside the scrollable area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.Unit
member.summary: Gets or sets a distance between two neighboring axis labels, gridlines and tick marks. The Unit value uses axis scale. If the Unit is 0, Axis Unit is automatically calculated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.ShowMajorGridLines
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether major grid lines should be shown.
member.value: true if major grid lines should be shown; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.MajorGridLineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the major grid line style.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.ShowMinorGridLines
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether minor grid lines should be shown.
member.value: true if minor grid lines should be shown; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.MinorGridLineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the minor grid line style.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineAxis.ShowThumb
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether thumb should be shown.
member.value: true if thumb should be shown; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the thumb style.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineSeries.DataMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets an expression string used to define data binding.
member.remarks: To specify binding it is necessary to divide column and value names using ; character (For example: Title = myTitleColumn; Time = myTimeColumn). The Character = is used to split Property Value name from Column name (For example: Time= myTime).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.TimelineSeries.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a data source used to bind data to this series.
member.remarks: An entry is created for every record, and the properties of the entry will be filled with a value from the specified data source. The series will be filled with created data points. The property should be specified.

member.returns: The value to be passed to the source object.

member.summary: Adds an additonal Resx file in which the control will pull its resources from.

The assembly in which the resx file is embedded.
member.remarks: Don't include the extension of the file, but prefix it with the default Namespace of the assembly.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Timelines.XamTimeline.UnregisterResources(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a previously registered resx file.
member.param: The name of the embedded resx file that was used for registration.
member.remarks: Note: this won't have any effect on controls that are already in view and are already displaying strings. It will only affect any new controls created.
